content: Stocks Discussion Investments Asked by David Maximilian TeyAsked on 27 Aug 2019How do I get hardcopy annual reports from companies that I have invested in?I have an account in FSMOne and they offer custodian accounts only, so I am unable to link my CDP account to it and obtain the hardcopy annual report through the brokerage. Was wondering if there is any way around it to obtain it? I have seen annual report request forms before but it is a bit unclear for me as to what I should do and where can I find the relevant information.I would appreciate your advice!1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Gabriel Tham, Tag Team Member at Kenichi Tag TeamLevel 8. WizardUpdated on 31 Aug 2019If you are using a custodian account like FSMOne, you need to contact your broker to request for the annual report.3 comments0

See all 3 comments Gabriel Tham30 Aug 2019Yea, the custodian brokerage should be the one giving it to you....David Maximilian Tey02 Sep 2019Ahh I see.  I messaged them and they told me to refer to the exchange or company for e-Annual Report, which still doesn't help me. Anyways thank You!
